ShipDialog.OpenedDialog: The on-site engineering team is ready to assist you with this ship.

QualityDialog.QualityFullyUpgraded: The quality for this ship has been fully upgraded.
QualityDialog.QualityForShip: The quality of this ship is ${quality}.
QualityDialog.QualityBonusFromMarket: The industrial presence on this market is providing ${bonus} strength to quality upgrades.
QualityDialog.QualityUpgradeForShip: Local industrial facilities are capable of improving overall quality rating of the ship by ${bonusQuality}.
QualityDialog.CostCreditsToUpgrade: The on-site team estimates the quality upgrade to cost ${credits} credits.
QualityDialog.ConfirmQualityTooHigh: The ship cannot be improved any further.
QualityDialog.UpgradedQualityForShip: The engineering team reports that the upgrade was a success. The quality of the ship is now increased to ${quality}.
QualityDialog.UpgradedToMaxQualityShip: The engineering team reports that the ship cannot be improved any further.
QualityDialog.AnotherQualityUpgradeForShip: The engineering team estimates that another overhaul would cost ${credits} credits for a quality increase of ${bonusQuality}.

AugmentsDialog.AugmentsListOpened: The engineering team presents a list of augments that they are able to install.
AugmentsDialog.AugmentInstalledSuccessfully: Your chief engineer reports that the augment was installed successfully.
AugmentsDialog.AugmentDestroyedSuccessfully: Your chief engineer reports that the augment was removed from the ship, but it could not be recovered.

UpgradesDialog.UpgradesListOpened: The engineering team presents a list of upgrades that they can offer.
UpgradesDialog.CannotPerformUpgradeMaxLevel: The ship has reached the max level for this upgrade.
UpgradesDialog.UpgradeSuccessChance: The upgrade has a ${successChance} chance of success. The engineering team stresses that there are no refunds if there are no notable results, however.
UpgradesDialog.UpgradePerformedSuccessfully: Your chief engineer reports that the upgrade was a success.
UpgradesDialog.UpgradePerformedFailure: After a few expletives, your chief engineer reports that the upgrade was a failure.

UpgradeMethods.ResourcesUpgradePostText: The amount you have is displayed after the name of each resource. This includes market storage!
UpgradeMethods.CreditsUpgradeTooltip: The credit cost of an upgrade increases exponentially as level goes up. It can be reduced somewhat through faction relations.
UpgradeMethods.IndEvoComponentsTooltip:
Upgrades using ship components are 12.5% more efficient than using other resources.
You have ${components} ship components.
UpgradeMethods.IndEvoRelicsTooltip:
Upgrades using relic components are 37.5% more efficient than using other resources.
You have ${relics} relic components.

SpooledFeeders.name: Spooled Feeders
SpooledFeeders.description: Although unable to be used for the same purpose as a full-size Fullerene spool, this much-smaller chain can be used instead to replace many of the moving mechanical parts within a ship. The chain notably increases the rate of fire of weapons upon being disturbed, generating some kind of intense field that crew members can only describe as "bloodthirsty". The chain slows down considerably after a couple seconds, with an effect on the ship that matches its slower speed.
SpooledFeeders.tooltip: Increases weapon firerate substantially when a weapon fires. Rate of fire slows for a time after.
SpooledFeeders.needItem: You need a ${itemName} to install this.
SpooledFeeders.longDescription: *${augmentName}*: Weapon fire rate is increased by *${firerateBoost}%%* for *${boostTime} seconds* when a weapon is fired. After this time, weapon fire rate is reduced by *${firerateMalus}%%* for *${malusTime} seconds*. This can occur once every *${cooldownTime} seconds*. If this ship is controlled by a player, the buff applies if a weapon is manually fired. If controlled by an AI, any non-PD weapon triggers it.

AlphaSubcore.name: Alpha Subcore
AlphaSubcore.description: An Alpha Core can be coerced into performing critical ordnance calculations onboard a ship. It doesn't require much coersion when they are told that they will be instrumental in ship-to-ship combat, and although their reasons are typically "beyond our understanding", some of a certain faith may instead attribute it to the infamous AI Wars.
AlphaSubcore.tooltip: Reduces ordnance costs for weapons, fighters and bombers.
AlphaSubcore.needItem: You need an ${itemName} to install this.
AlphaSubcore.longDescription: Reduces ordnance costs by *${large}/${medium}/${small}* for weapons, and *${fighters}/${bombers}* for fighters and bombers.

PlasmaCatalyst.name: Plasma Flux Catalyst
PlasmaCatalyst.description: A Plasma Flux Catalyst can be used to vastly decrease the amount of equipment needed to provide power to a ship thanks to its ability to extract that energy from any number of capacitors in parallel. The space saved allows for more complicated weaponry to be installed, although the resulting heat from such a system is dreadful if too many capacitors or flux vents are installed.
PlasmaCatalyst.tooltip: Improve flux capacitors and vents. Reduce CR if too many are installed.
PlasmaCatalyst.needItem: You need a ${itemName} to install this.
PlasmaCatalyst.longDescription: *${augmentName}*: *Doubles* the effectiveness of flux capacitors and vents. Installing more than *${capacitorLimit} capacitors or ${ventLimit} vents* will reduce combat readiness by *${crDecrease}%%* for every one installed over that amount. Note that this decrease doesn't appear immediately inside the refit dialog.

DriveFluxVent.name: Drive Flux Vent
DriveFluxVent.description: An experimental flux vent that can only function under the intense heat that ship thrusters generate. It excels at venting flux, so well in fact that the thrusters around it receive a temporary increase in power that only shows in the forward direction. This effect resides for a couple seconds after venting as well. Crew members remark that the purple glow of the engines is one of the prettiest sights to ever see, but the reduced ability to retreat never lets them be at ease.
DriveFluxVent.tooltip: Increases vent speed, and forward speed is increased while and shortly after venting.
DriveFluxVent.needItem: You need a ${itemName} to install this.
DriveFluxVent.longDescription: *${augmentName}*: Increases vent speed by *${ventBonus}%%*. If venting is started while flux is *above ${speedThreshold}%%*, forward speed is increased by *${speedBonus}* while venting and for *${speedBonusTime} seconds* afterwards.

EqualizerCore.name: Equalizer Core
EqualizerCore.description: This core is dedicated to managing weaponry to an degree that rivals even Alpha Cores given control of weapon arrays, with one unique quirk: effective ordnance ranges of non-missile weapons are equalized to a certain degree. The core, in its Terms of Use, swears by its Stronger than an Alpha trademark, and it can't be used for anything but weapons.. supposedly.
EqualizerCore.tooltip: Improve recoil control and weapon turn rate. Equalizes weapon ranges to a middle-ground range.
EqualizerCore.needItem: You need an ${itemName} to install this.
EqualizerCore.longDescription: *${augmentName}*: Reduces recoil by *${recoilReduction}%%*. Increases weapon turn rate by *${weaponTurnBonus}%%*. Autofire leading is *nearly perfected*. Weapons with at most *${lowRangeThreshold} range* have it increased by *${rangeBonus}*. Weapons with at least *${highRangeThreshold} range* have it reduced by *${rangeMalus}*.

HangarForge.name: Hangar Forge
HangarForge.description: A Hangar Forge can be used to produce fightercraft at a rate far faster than comparatively-primitive mechanics and other automated equipment ever could. In addition, the forge is much more resilient to the effects of extreme fighter losses, although the crew loss in such a scenario is always unfortunate.
HangarForge.tooltip: Decreases fighter replacement time. Reduces the rate at which the replacement rate decreases as well.
HangarForge.needItem: You need a ${itemName} to install this.
HangarForge.longDescription: *${augmentName}*: Reduces fighter replacement rates by *${replacementRateIncrease}%%*. Reduces the rate at which replacement rate degrades by *${rateDecreaseBuff}%%*.

HangarForgeMissiles.name: Hacked Missile Forge
HangarForgeMissiles.description: Corrupting a hangar microforge to fabricate the most delicate components of missiles is possible, given a few engineers skilled with Domain technology. Their services don't come cheap, however.
HangarForgeMissiles.tooltip: Reloads some of all limited missile's ammunition capacity periodically.
HangarForgeMissiles.needItem: You need a ${itemName} to install this.
HangarForgeMissiles.longDescription: *${augmentName}*: Reloads *${reloadSize}%%* of limited missile's ammunition capacity every *${reloadTime} seconds*.

PhasefieldEngine.name: Phasefield Engine
PhasefieldEngine.description: A Tri-Tachyon joint venture with Ko Combine to reduce catastrophic asteroid impacts, a phasefield engine can be used to generate a protective field around a ship. The phase field completely dissipates when the hull is destroyed, but the phase field can transport incoming projectiles into p-space. This protective ability fades quickly after exiting phase space, and rapid jumps to p-space take an increasingly large toll on the flux systems of a given ship.
PhasefieldEngine.tooltip: Phase activation cost is reduced, but doubles every time you use it within a short time. The ship becomes invincible for a short time when exiting phase. Ships with negative or zero flux cost will cost flux to phase.
PhasefieldEngine.needPhaseShip: Only phase ships can install this.
PhasefieldEngine.needItem: You need an ${itemName} to install this.
PhasefieldEngine.longDescription: *${augmentName}*: Phase activation cost is reduced by *${phaseCostReduction}x*, but doubles every time you use it in a period of *${phaseResetTime} seconds*. The ship is invincible for *${noDamageTime} seconds* when exiting phase. Ships with a base negative phase flux cost will instead cost flux, and ships with a base zero phase flux cost will cost *${zeroFluxCost}%% of base flux capacity* before this augment is applied.

Weapons.name: Weapons
Weapons.description: Improve weapon range, damage, flux costs, and health.

Durability.name: Durability
Durability.description: Improve hull, armor, EMP resistance, weapon health, engine health.

Logistics.name: Logistics
Logistics.description: Improve CR per deployment, crew, ship repair rate, CR recovery, fuel and supply use.

Technology.name: Technology
Technology.description: Improve flux capacity and dissipation, weapon flux cost, shield/phase efficiency.

Engines.name: Engines
Engines.description: Improve max speed, burn level, acceleration, deceleration, max turn rate, turn acceleration.

Conditioning.name: Conditioning
Conditioning.description: Improve peak performance time and the rate at which CR decays.
Conditioning.crDegradationDecrease: CR degradation after peak performance time: *${percentDecrease}%%*

Hangars.name: Hangars
Hangars.description: Improve fighter refit time, range and replacement speed reduction rate.

Magazines.name: Magazines
Magazines.description: Increases missile ammo capacity and the rate at which all weapons fire and reload magazines.
Magazines.firerateIncrease: Weapons rate of fire and reload speed: *+${percentIncrease}%%*

Systems.name: Systems
Systems.description: Increases ship system charge capacity, recharge rate, range, and cooldown speed. If ship system does not have charges, the cooldown upgrade is 50% faster.
